Technique: FORMED BY HAND; PAINTED; ENGRAVED; FAYENCE; ENGRAVED
Name: Shabti of Padihormeden
Description: This funerary statuette in beige faience, dating from the Late Period, belongs to Padihormeden, son of Tadimont. Many egyptian collections  of Belgium and in the whole world preserve the shabtis of this person. The piece was part of the G. Hagemans collection, purchased by the Museum in 1861.
